title: Import Palmer‚Äôs penguins data
text:
Data overview: The palmerpenguins data contains size measurements for three penguin species observed on three islands in the Palmer Archipelago, Antarctica.
Data collection: These data were collected from 2007 - 2009 by Dr.¬†Kristen Gorman with the Palmer Station Long Term Ecological Research Program, part of the US Long Term Ecological Research Network. The data were imported directly from the Environmental Data Initiative (EDI) Data Portal, and are available for use by CC0 license (‚ÄúNo Rights Reserved‚Äù) in accordance with the Palmer Station Data Policy. - Source: Allison Horst

title: Import Palmer‚Äôs penguins data
text:
Data overview: The palmerpenguins data contains size measurements for three penguin species observed on three islands in the Palmer Archipelago, Antarctica.
Data collection: These data were collected from 2007 - 2009 by Dr.¬†Kristen Gorman with the Palmer Station Long Term Ecological Research Program, part of the US Long Term Ecological Research Network. The data were imported directly from the Environmental Data Initiative (EDI) Data Portal, and are available for use by CC0 license (‚ÄúNo Rights Reserved‚Äù) in accordance with the Palmer Station Data Policy. - Source: Allison Horst

title: Import Palmer‚Äôs penguins data
text:
Cleanup penguins
For our purposes, we need to remove any entries that are missing the sex value.

palmer_penguins_clean <- palmer_penguins_raw |> 
  filter(
  !is.na(sex)
)

palmer_penguins_clean


  



Ok, that brought our count down to 333 penguins. We‚Äôre ready to export for our analysis!

title: Import Palmer‚Äôs penguins data
text:
Export penguins
Let‚Äôs export our dataset as an RDS file for our analysis

palmer_penguins_clean |> write_rds("data-processed/palmer_penguins_clean.RDS")

title: Palmer‚Äôs penguins analysis
text:
Let‚Äôs find out:

How many male and female penguins there are
How many of each type was observed
Average bill length by sex
Average bill length by species

title: Palmer‚Äôs penguins analysis

Let‚Äôs find out:

How many male and female penguins there are

title: Palmer‚Äôs penguins analysis
text:
Import penguins
About our data: The palmerpenguins data contains size measurements for three penguin species observed on three islands in the Palmer Archipelago, Antarctica.These data were collected from 2007 - 2009 by Dr.¬†Kristen Gorman with the Palmer Station Long Term Ecological Research Program, part of the US Long Term Ecological Research Network. The data were imported directly from the Environmental Data Initiative (EDI) Data Portal, and are available for use by CC0 license (‚ÄúNo Rights Reserved‚Äù) in accordance with the Palmer Station Data Policy. - Source: Allison Horst
Notes about units:

Lengths: all lengths in the dataset are measured in millimeters.
Mass: Mass is measured in grams.


palmer_penguins <- read_rds("data-processed/palmer_penguins_clean.RDS")

title: Palmer‚Äôs penguins analysis
text:
Count observations

How many of each sex?

palmer_penguins |> count(sex, name = "penguin count")


  



üìç Data takeaway: Of the 355 penguins with data available from 2007 to 2009, roughly half were male and half were female.


How many of each type?

palmer_penguins |> count(species, name = "penguin_count") |> mutate(
  percent_total = penguin_count / nrow(palmer_penguins) * 100
)


  



üìç Data takeaway: Of the 355 penguins with data available from 2007 to 2009, about 44% were Adelie penguins, 36% were Gentoo penguins, and only 20% were Chinstrap penguins.


Average bill length by sex
Let‚Äôs figure out if there‚Äôs a difference between males and females

palmer_penguins |> group_by(sex) |> summarise(avg_bill_size = mean(bill_len))


  



üìç Data takeaway: Of the 355 penguins observed from 2007 to 2009, male bills were about four millimeters longer on average than female bills.


Average bill length by species
Let‚Äôs figure out if there‚Äôs a difference between species. We‚Äôll also get the group size.

palmer_penguins |> group_by(species) |> summarise(group_size = n(), avg_bill_size = mean(bill_len))


  



üìç Data takeaway: Of the three species observed, Chinstrap had the longest bills, with an average length of almost 49 millimeters. The Gentoo followed with an average length of about 48 millimeters, and the Adelie had the shortest bills of the group with an average length under 40 millimeters. st
